subject: Re: New member
author: Lisa
full_text:
The radio I was going to get today is the first one listed at ufogeek,
but it didn't have a speaker and only used headphones, so I thought
that was the wrong one. I got the mini 300 model with shortwave, and
just took the cover off, but I have NO idea what to look for since
this wasn't the one shown on the examples..and I don't think I have a
screwdriver small enough to get the circuit board off.....

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Kristin Morris" <ckmorris95@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Lisa!  Welcome.  I too am fairly new.  I joined the group
probably back
> in November but I didn't do any actual box research myself till this
week. I
> am happy to report that I have had an incredible luck getting and
hearing
> messages.  I use the RS 12-470.  This unfortunately is hard to get a
hold of
> because it is an old model.  It is gray and white versus the black
version
> that RS sells now.  But the 20-125 is readily available and
listening to the
> files from others who use the 20-125 it seems to be great!  I am
going to
> get one of those too.
> 
> As for hacking - I'm not technical either and didn't think I could
do it,
> but plenty of our members UFOGEEK.com (Mike Colletta) has step by step
> videos to walk you through.  It was not difficult.  You just have to
try.
> Anyway - I spent many months just listening to other people's clips
and I
> really believe that helped to train my ear so when I began my own
research
> it was a smooth transition.  I'm not saying to wait a couple months like
> me.. I was just chicken sh* t (if you know what I mean :-) )  but
listen to
> every clip you can - believe me it helps!  The people on the board are
> extremely helpful and want to see you succeed!
> 
>  
> 
> Welcome !!!
> 
> Kristin
> 
>  
>
